column36: 1/ Change of  methodology from 2016. The data from 2010 to 2015 are the product of a  statistical splice. Data prior to 2010  are not comparable with those of the 2010-2019 series.  2/ Starting 2004, as a result of the  importance of the "Survey on International Tourism", the estimates  of the series of the "Travel" item of the Balance of Payments were  modified. For this reason, the data are not rigorously comparable with those  of previous years.

1/ In 2017, a  "base year" was carried out that allowed updating the behavior  patterns of the land passes. From 2012 to 2015 they were estimated. From the  year 2019 the Outbound Tourism figures expand according to "Departures  of residents in Chile for tourist purposes". Before this methodological  change, the expansion was carried out according to "Arrivals at  destination of residents in Chile".

1/ Due to the  coronavirus epidemic in 2020, emergency measures were introduced, border  traffic was significantly lower than usual. In the second quarter of 2020,  data collection was suspended, so the production of these data was done by  model estimation and imputation. Due to the low number of data providers, the  reliability of the published data has decreased and they are only to a  limited extent comparable with the data of previous periods.
